Package com.example.app.models

Class Project

java.lang.Object
com.example.app.models.Project
All Implemented Interfaces:
BaseEntity
public class Project extends Object implements BaseEntity
Represents a project in the system. This class implements the BaseEntity interface. It contains project details such as ID, name, application dates, neighborhood, manager ID, visibility, officer limit, officers, groups, and flat count. Provides methods to manage officers, groups, and flats.
See Also:
  • BaseEntity
  • FlatType
  • MaritalStatus

  • Constructor Details

    • Project

      public Project()
      Default constructor for the Project class. This constructor initializes the officers and groups sets, and the flatCount map.

    • Project

      public Project(Integer id, String projectName, Date applicationOpenDate, Date applicationCloseDate, String neighborhood, Integer managerId, Boolean visibility, Integer officerLimit, Set<Integer> officers, Set<MaritalStatus> groups, Map<FlatType,Integer> flatCount)
      Constructor for the Project class with parameters.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the project. This field should be null for new projects. After saving to the database, it will be set.
      projectName - the name of the project. This should be unique
      applicationOpenDate - the date when the application opens
      applicationCloseDate - the date when the application closes
      neighborhood - the neighborhood where the project is located
      managerId - the ID of the manager responsible for the project
      visibility - the visibility status of the project
      officerLimit - the limit on the number of officers that can be assigned to the project
      officers - the set of officer IDs assigned to the project
      groups - the set of marital status groups that the project is open to
      flatCount - the map of flat types and their corresponding counts available in the project

      public void addOfficer(Integer officerId) throws OfficerAlreadyInsideException, OfficerLimitExceededException
      Gets the set of officer IDs assigned to the project.
      Throws:
      OfficerAlreadyInsideException - if the officer is already inside the project
      OfficerLimitExceededException - if the officer limit is exceeded

      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - to ensure the flatCount is mutable
      IllegalArgumentException - if the flat type is not available in this project
